description: Romano-British farming settlement with earlier Iron and Bronze Age activity. The Romano-British activity has been dated to the 1st to 2nd CE, during this time there was a circular structure with concentric circular enclosure ditches. This has been interpreted as a Romano-British shrine, despite a lack of votive deposits.
bibliography: “Excavation of the Deserted Medieval Village at Coton Park, Rugby, Warwickshire, 1998,” 2000. https://doi.org/10.5284/1026927.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Coton Park, Rugby (Warwickshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
